newsitem.title: USA: Cambridge Technology adopts rights plan.
newsitem.headline: Cambridge Technology adopts rights plan.

text.p: Cambridge Technology Partners Inc said Monday its board had adopted a stockholder rights plan giving stockholders one preferred stock purchase right for each outstanding share of common stock.
The rights would be exercisable if someone acquires or tries to acquire beneficial ownership of 15 percent or more of the company's common stock.
The rights are to be distributed to stockholders of record as of the close of business on July 3, 1997. The rights expire June 23, 2007 unless earlier redeemed or exchanged.
Each Right entitles holders to buy one one-thousandth of a share of a new series of junior participating preferred stock at an exercise price of $200, the company said.
A statement from the company said the plan was not adopted in response to any specific offer or threat.
